nasal obstruction.context: 1. Nasal obstruction secondary to deviated nasal septum.

deviated nasal septum.context: 1. Nasal obstruction secondary to deviated nasal septum.

cosmetic rhinoplasty.context: Cosmetic rhinoplasty. Request for cosmetic change in the external appearance of the nose.

26-year-old white female.context: The patient is a 26-year-old white female with longstanding nasal obstruction.

longstanding nasal obstruction.context: The patient is a 26-year-old white female with longstanding nasal obstruction.

concerns with regard to the external app.context: She also has concerns with regard to the external appearance of her nose and is requesting changes in the external appearance of her nose.

severe left-sided nasal septal deviation.context: From her functional standpoint, she has severe left-sided nasal septal deviation with compensatory inferior turbinate hypertrophy.

compensatory inferior turbinate hypertro.context: From her functional standpoint, she has severe left-sided nasal septal deviation with compensatory inferior turbinate hypertrophy.

over projected nose.context: From the aesthetic standpoint, the nose is over projected, lacks rotation, and has a large dorsal hump.

lacks rotation.context: From the aesthetic standpoint, the nose is over projected, lacks rotation, and has a large dorsal hump.

large dorsal hump.context: From the aesthetic standpoint, the nose is over projected, lacks rotation, and has a large dorsal hump.

straighten the nasal septum.context: First we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

reduce the size of the turbinates.context: First we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

take down the hump.context: First we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

rotate the tip of the nose.context: First we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

de-project the nasal tip.context: First we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

left hemitransfixion incision.context: Procedure began with a left hemitransfixion incision, which was brought down into the left intercartilaginous incision.

right intercartilaginous incision.context: Right intercartilaginous incision was also made and the dorsum of the nose was elevated in the submucoperichondrial and subperiosteal plane.

severe left-sided nasal septal deviation.context: Intact bilateral septomucoperichondrial flaps were elevated and a severe left-sided nasal septal deviation was corrected by detachment of the caudal nasal septum from the maxillary crest in a swinging door fashion and placing it back into the midline.

posterior vomerine spur was divided.context: Posterior vomerine spur was divided superiorly and inferiorly and a large spur was removed.

large spur was removed.context: Posterior vomerine spur was divided superiorly and inferiorly and a large spur was removed.

anterior and inferior one-third of each.context: Anterior and inferior one-third of each inferior turbinate was clamped, cut, and resected.

upper lateral cartilages were divided fr.context: The upper lateral cartilages were divided from their attachments to the dorsal nasal septum and the cartilaginous septum was lowered by approximately 2 mm.

cartilaginous septum was lowered by appr.context: The upper lateral cartilages were divided from their attachments to the dorsal nasal septum and the cartilaginous septum was lowered by approximately 2 mm.

bony hump of the nose was lowered with a.context: The bony hump of the nose was lowered with a straight osteotome by 4 mm.

fading medial osteotomies were carried o.context: Fading medial osteotomies were carried out and lateral osteotomies were then created in order to narrow the bony width of the nose.

lateral osteotomies were then created.context: Fading medial osteotomies were carried out and lateral osteotomies were then created in order to narrow the bony width of the nose.

tip of the nose was then addressed via a.context: The tip of the nose was then addressed via a retrograde dissection and removal of cephalic caudal semicircle cartilage medially at the tip.

removal of cephalic caudal semicircle ca.context: The tip of the nose was then addressed via a retrograde dissection and removal of cephalic caudal semicircle cartilage medially at the tip.

caudal septum was shortened by 2 mm in a.context: The caudal septum was shortened by 2 mm in an angle in order to enhance rotation.

medial crural footplates were reattached.context: Medial crural footplates were reattached to the caudal nasal septum with a projection rotation control suture of #3-0 chromic.

upper lateral cartilages were rejoined t.context: The upper lateral cartilages were rejoined to the dorsal septum with a #4-0 plain gut suture.

intact mucoperichondrial flaps were clos.context: Intact mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture and Doyle nasal splints were placed on either side of the nasal septum.

Doyle nasal splints were placed on eithe.context: Intact mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture and Doyle nasal splints were placed on either side of the nasal septum.

middle meatus was filled with Surgicel a.context: The middle meatus was filled with Surgicel and Cortisporin otic and external Denver splint was applied with sterile tape and Mastisol.

external Denver splint was applied with.context: The middle meatus was filled with Surgicel and Cortisporin otic and external Denver splint was applied with sterile tape and Mastisol.

excellent aesthetic and functional resul.context: Excellent aesthetic and functional results were thus obtained and the patient was awakened in the operating room, taken to the recovery room in good condition.
